title: Tiffany's extraordinary advent calendar will set you back an eye-watering £104,000

Tiffany & Co. has announced it will be releasing a limited edition advent calendar full of its signature jewels for Christmas - but only for one extremely lucky person.

The luxury calendar, which launches in stores in a fortnight, will contain gifts that cost between £100 and £13,000 - and come in at £104,000.

Behind every door of the four-foot-tall keepsake lies a gift presented in a famed Tiffany Blue Box, featuring everything from pure diamond pendants and the new Tiffany 1837 Makers watch, to designs from the Tiffany T collection.

But only two will go on sale around the world - and just one in the UK - which will land in Harrods on November, 9.

The calendar itself was inspired by the brand's flagship store façade, and was designed by artist and illustrator Pat Vale.

(Image: LightRocket via Getty Images)

(Image: Digital Communications|E-Commerce)

There are 24 doors and each day reveals a jewellery box tied with a red ribbon.

While many of the gifts have been left a surprise, presents include four diamond pendants and a brand new Tiffany 1837 Makers watch.

Available from November 9th, exclusively in Harrods, the Tiffany & Co. advent calendar starts from £104,000.

But, for those after a bit of Christmas sparkle on a lesser price rag, Missoma will also be launching a jewellery advent calendar this year.

(Image: Print Advertising|Special Ad Exe)

Called the 12 Days to Shine calendar, a waiting list has already launched for the product which is priced at £395.

Luxury advent calendars - containing a gift to be unwrapped every day throughout December - have become a craze in recent years, filled with everything from jewels, to gin, festive teas and cosmetics.

Last year, Boots took the top price, after having to launch a waiting list for its No7 calendar, which reached almost 100,000 people and sold out within three day.

It's also set to make a return this year.

description: The calendar, set to be one of the most expensive in the world, will land in stores on 9 November - but only two people in to world will be able to get their hands on it
